Package org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree

Class DiffTree

java.lang.Object
org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffTree
public class DiffTree extends Object
Implementation of variation tree diffs from our ESEC/FSE'22 paper. An instance of this class represents a variation tree diff. It stores the root of the graph as a DiffNode. It optionally holds a DiffTreeSource that describes how the variation tree diff was obtained. The graph structure is implemented by the DiffNode class.
Author:
Paul Bittner, SÃ¶ren Viegener

    • DiffTree

      public DiffTree​(DiffNode root)
      Creates a DiffTree that only consists of the single given root node.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of this tree.

    • DiffTree

      public DiffTree​(DiffNode root, DiffTreeSource source)
      Creates a DiffTree that only consists of the single given root node. Remembers the given source as the tree's source of creation.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of this tree.
      source - The data from which the DiffTree was created.

  • Method Details

    • fromFile

      public static DiffResult<DiffTree> fromFile​(Path p, boolean collapseMultipleCodeLines, boolean ignoreEmptyLines) throws IOException
      Same as fromFile(Path, boolean, boolean, DiffNodeParser) but with the default parser for the lines in the diff.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • fromDiff

      public static DiffResult<DiffTree> fromDiff​(String diff, boolean collapseMultipleCodeLines, boolean ignoreEmptyLines)
      Same as fromDiff(String, boolean, boolean, DiffNodeParser) but with the default parser for the lines in the diff.

    • fromFile

      public static DiffResult<DiffTree> fromFile​(Path p, boolean collapseMultipleCodeLines, boolean ignoreEmptyLines, DiffNodeParser annotationParser) throws IOException
      Parses a DiffTree from the given file. The file should contain a text-based diff without any meta information. So just lines preceded by "+", "-", or " " are expected.
      Parameters:
      p - Path to a diff file.
      collapseMultipleCodeLines - Set to true if subsequent lines of source code with the same type of change should be collapsed into a single source code node representing all lines at once.
      ignoreEmptyLines - Set to true if empty lines should not be included in the DiffTree.
      annotationParser - The parser that is used to parse lines in the diff to DiffNodes.
      Returns:
      A result either containing the parsed DiffTree or an error message in case of failure.
      Throws:
      IOException - when the given file could not be read for some reason.

    • fromDiff

      public static DiffResult<DiffTree> fromDiff​(String diff, boolean collapseMultipleCodeLines, boolean ignoreEmptyLines, DiffNodeParser annotationParser)
      Parses a DiffTree from the given unix diff. The file should contain a text-based diff without any meta information. So just lines preceded by "+", "-", or " " are expected.
      Parameters:
      diff - The diff as text. Lines should be separated by a newline character. Each line should be preceded by either "+", "-", or " ".
      collapseMultipleCodeLines - Set to true if subsequent lines of source code with the same type of change should be collapsed into a single source code node representing all lines at once.
      ignoreEmptyLines - Set to true if empty lines should not be included in the DiffTree.
      annotationParser - The parser that is used to parse lines in the diff to DiffNodes.
      Returns:
      A result either containing the parsed DiffTree or an error message in case of failure.

    • forAll

      public DiffTree forAll​(Consumer<DiffNode> procedure)
      Invokes the given callback for each node in this DiffTree.
      Parameters:
      procedure - callback
      Returns:
      this

    • traverse

      public DiffTree traverse​(DiffTreeVisitor visitor)
      Traverse this DiffTree with the given visitor. When visiting a node, the visitor decides how to proceed.
      Parameters:
      visitor - visitor that is invoked on the root first and then decides how to proceed the traversal.
      Returns:
      this

    • allMatch

      public boolean allMatch​(Predicate<DiffNode> condition)
      Checks whether all nodes in this tree satisfy the given condition. The condition might not be invoked on every node in case it is not necessary.
      Parameters:
      condition - A condition to check on each node.
      Returns:
      True iff the given condition returns true for all nodes in this tree.

    • anyMatch

      public boolean anyMatch​(Predicate<DiffNode> condition)
      Checks whether any node in this tree satisfies the given condition. The condition might not be invoked on every node in case a node is found.
      Parameters:
      condition - A condition to check on each node.
      Returns:
      True iff the given condition returns true for at least one node in this tree.

    • noneMatch

      public boolean noneMatch​(Predicate<DiffNode> condition)
      Checks whether no node in this tree satisfies the given condition. The condition might not be invoked on every node.
      Parameters:
      condition - A condition to check on each node.
      Returns:
      True iff the given condition returns false for every node in this tree.

    • getRoot

      public DiffNode getRoot()
      Returns the root node of this tree.

    • computeAllNodesThat

      public List<DiffNode> computeAllNodesThat​(Predicate<DiffNode> property)
      Returns all nodes that satisfy the given predicate. Traverses the DiffTree once.
      Parameters:
      property - Filter for nodes. Should return true if a node should be included.
      Returns:
      A List of all nodes satisfying the given predicate.

    • computeArtifactNodes

      public List<DiffNode> computeArtifactNodes()
      Returns all artifact nodes of this DiffTree.
      See Also:
      computeAllNodesThat(java.util.function.Predicate<org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode>)

    • computeAllNodes

      public List<DiffNode> computeAllNodes()
      Returns all nodes in this DiffTree. Traverses the DiffTree once.

    • count

      public int count​(Predicate<DiffNode> nodesToCount)
      Returns the number of nodes in this tree that satisfy the given condition.
      Parameters:
      nodesToCount - A condition that returns true for each node that should be counted.
      Returns:
      The number of nodes in this tree that satisfy the given condition.

    • getSource

      public DiffTreeSource getSource()
      Returns the source of this DiffTree (i.e., the data this DiffTree was created from).
      See Also:
      DiffTreeSource

    • computeSize

      public int computeSize()
      Returns the number of nodes in this DiffTree.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true iff this tree is empty. The tree is considered empty if it only has a root or if it has no nodes at all.

    • removeNode

      public void removeNode​(DiffNode node)
      Removes the given node from the DiffTree but keeps its children. The children are moved up, meaning that they are located below the parent of the given node afterwards.
      Parameters:
      node - The node to remove. Cannot be the root.

    • toTextDiff

      public String toTextDiff()
      Unparses this DiffTree into a text-based diff.
      Returns:
      A text-based diff.

    • assertConsistency

      public void assertConsistency()
      Checks whether this DiffTree is consistent. Throws an error when this DiffTree is inconsistent (e.g., if it has cycles or an invalid internal state). Has no side-effects otherwise.
      See Also:
      isConsistent()

    • isConsistent

      public ConsistencyResult isConsistent()
      Checks whether this DiffTree is consistent.
      Returns:
      A result that indicates either consistency or inconsistency.

      Overrides:
